resources.string: Moonlight is testing your network connection to determine if any required ports are blocked.\n\nThis may take a few seconds…

Your network does not appear to be blocking Moonlight. If you still have trouble connecting, check your PC\'s firewall settings.\n\nIf you are trying to stream over the Internet, install the Moonlight Internet Hosting Tool on your PC and run the included Internet Streaming Tester to check your PC\'s Internet connection.
The network test could not be performed because none of Moonlight\'s connection testing servers were reachable. Check your Internet connection or try again later.

Your device's current network connection seems to be blocking Moonlight. Streaming over the Internet may not work while connected to this network.

The following network ports were blocked:
Your device\'s current network connection is blocking Moonlight. Streaming over the Internet may not work while connected to this network.
Computer is currently in a game. You must close the game before pairing.
Please enter the following PIN on the target PC:
If your host PC is running Sunshine, navigate to the Sunshine web UI to enter the PIN.
Unable to wake PC because there is no stored MAC address
It may take a few seconds for your PC to wake up. If it doesn\'t, make sure it\'s configured properly for Wake-On-LAN.
The ComputerManager service is not running. Please wait a few seconds or restart the app.
GFE returned an HTTP 404 error. Make sure your PC is running a supported GPU. Using remote desktop software can also cause this error. Try rebooting your machine or reinstalling GFE.
Moonlight has crashed due to an incompatibility with this device\'s video decoder. Try adjusting the streaming settings if the crashes continue.
Your device\'s video decoder continues to crash at your selected streaming settings. Your streaming settings have been reset to default.
USB access is prohibited by your device administrator. Check your Knox or MDM settings.
Your current launcher does not allow for creating pinned shortcuts.
Video decoder failed to initialize. Your device may not support the selected resolution or frame rate.
Your network connection isn\'t performing well. Reduce your video bitrate setting or try a faster connection.
Something went wrong on your host PC when starting the stream.\n\nMake sure you don\'t have any DRM-protected content open on your host PC. You can also try restarting your host PC.
The host PC reported a fatal video encoding error.\n\nTry disabling HDR mode, changing the streaming resolution, or changing your host PC\'s display resolution.
Check your firewall and port forwarding rules for port(s):
Warning: Your active network connection is metered!
Searching for host PCs on your local network…\n\n Ensure Sunshine is running on your host PC or GameStream is enabled in the GeForce Experience SHIELD settings.
Are you sure you want to delete this PC?
Slow connection to PC\nReduce your bitrate
Incoming frame rate from network: %1$.2f FPS
Frames dropped by your network connection: %1$.2f%%
Are you sure you want to quit the running app? All unsaved data will be lost.
Send WIN + G (Open Xbox Game Bar)
Drag the slider to adjust bitrate in real-time. Higher values mean better quality but require better network.
Unable to connect to the specified computer. Make sure the required ports are allowed through the firewall.
Unable to resolve PC address. Make sure you didn\'t make a typo in the address.
You must enter an IP address
That address doesn\'t look right. You must use your router\'s public IP address for streaming over the Internet.
Increase to improve image clarity. Decrease for better performance on lower end devices and slower networks.

Native resolution and/or FPS may not be supported by the streaming server. You will probably need to configure a matching custom display mode for the host PC manually.

If you choose to create a custom resolution in NVIDIA Control Panel to match your screen settings, please ensure you have read and understood NVIDIA's warning regarding possible monitor damage, PC instability, and other potential problems.

We are not responsible for any problems resulting from creating a custom resolution on your PC.

It may be that your monitor does not support a necessary display configurationItem. If so, you may try to set up a virtual monitor. Finally, if your device or host PC does not support streaming at a specific resolution or refresh rate, you're out of luck unfortunately.
Increase for a smoother video stream. Decrease for better performance on lower end devices.
Increase for better image quality. Decrease to improve performance on slower connections.

The resolution requested to the host is equivalent to the client\'s base resolution * scale factor. This will change the game rendering material precision on the host side (super-resolution streaming). Reducing this ratio can also be used to reduce GPU pressure on the host side. ⚠Note: Check if the host supports the scaled resolution before applying this option.
Invalid resolution format, please use width x height format
Enable 5.1 or 7.1 surround sound for home-theater systems
Allow audio effects to work during streaming, may increase audio latency
Enable immersive 3D audio experience using Android Spatializer. Requires Android 13+ and compatible audio output device. Best experience with 5.1 or 7.1 surround sound configuration
Redirect device microphone to the host computer for voice chat and communication, requires Sunshine-Foundation version 20250720 or higher on the host.
Adjust the audio quality of microphone redirection. Higher bitrates provide better audio quality but use more bandwidth.
Lower display refresh rates can save power at the expense of some additional video latency
Unchecking this option forces a gamepad to always be present
Vibrates your device to emulate rumble if your gamepad does not support it
Amplify or reduce the vibration intensity on your device
Note: Some games can enforce a larger deadzone than what Moonlight is configured to use.
Enables a built-in USB driver for devices without native Xbox controller support
Use Moonlight\'s USB driver for all supported gamepads, even if native Xbox controller support is present
Long pressing the Start button will switch the gamepad into mouse mode
Switches the face buttons A/B and X/Y for gamepads and the on-screen controls
Forces gamepad touchpad input to control the host mouse, even when emulating a gamepad with a touchpad.
Allow use of gamepad motion sensors
Enables supported hosts to request motion sensor data when emulating a gamepad with motion sensors. Disabling may slightly reduce power and network usage if motion sensors are not being used in game.

Uses your device\'s built-in motion sensors if gamepad sensors are not supported by your connected gamepad or your Android version.\nNote: Enabling this option may cause your gamepad to appear as a PlayStation controller on the host.
Use the touchscreen as a trackpad
If enabled, the touchscreen acts like a trackpad. If disabled, multi-point touch will be enabled.
Synchronize touch event with display refresh
If enabled, touch event will be synchronized with display refresh rate, like 60Hz.
Flat region for long press jitter elimination in multi-point touch mode
Works for the whole screen. Increase for larger long-press flat region, within which the app sends initial contact coordinates to server.
Enable keyboard toggle in multi-point touch mode
Least number of fingers to tap to toggle local on-screen keyboard in multi-point touch mode. \nIn trackpad mode, you always only need to tap 3 or more fingers to toggle local keyboard.
This can make mouse acceleration behave more naturally for remote desktop usage, but it is incompatible with many games.
Allow ESC key to open return menu
When enabled, double-pressing ESC key opens the stream return menu, single ESC press is passed through to host
Enable back and forward mouse buttons
Enabling this option may break right clicking on some buggy devices
Reverse enhanced touch zone to the left (default: on the right side of screen)
Defines where to divide native-touch and enhanced-touch zones, less than 50% means divide from a point on the left, more than 50% means right
Less than 50% means divide from a point on the left, more than 50% means right
Set pointer velocity factor for enhanced touch zone. Set 100% to disable
Set pointer velocity factor for enhanced touch zone. Set 100% to disable
Set fixed X (horizontal) velocity. Set 0 to disable fixed x velocity mode. Larger than 0 means disable horizontal velocity factor to use fixed velocity instead.
Set fixed X (horizontal) velocity in pixels. Set 0 to disable fixed x velocity.
Show virtual controller overlay on touchscreen
Vibrates your device to emulate rumble for the on-screen controls
Hide all virtual buttons except L3 and R3
Show the guide button on screen
Resets all on-screen controls to their default size and position
Are you sure you want to delete your saved on-screen controls layout?
Make the on-screen controls more/less transparent
Allows the stream to be viewed (but not controlled) while multitasking
Smaller box art in the app grid allows more apps to be visible on screen
Allow GFE to modify game settings for optimal streaming
Play audio from the computer and this device
Streaming at 90 or 120 FPS may reduce latency on high-end devices but can cause lag or instability on devices that can\'t support it
Disable on-screen connection warning messages while streaming
May reduce micro-stuttering on some devices, but can increase latency
Newer codecs can lower video bandwidth requirements if your device supports them. Codec selections may be ignored if not supported by the host software or GPU.
Stream HDR when the game and PC GPU support it. HDR requires a GPU with HEVC Main 10 encoding support.
This will cause loss of detail in light and dark areas if your device doesn\'t properly display full range video content.
Display real-time stream performance information while streaming
Choose the display orientation for performance statistics
Choose top/bottom for horizontal orientation, or four corner positions for vertical orientation
Reset performance overlay to preset position
Select information items to display in the performance overlay
Display a latency information message after the stream ends
Lock screen when disconnecting and exiting the stream
Automatically lock the device screen after disconnecting and exiting the stream
View instructions on how to set up your gaming PC for streaming
View tips for diagnosing and fixing common streaming issues
View app information and project details
Moonlight V+ is an enhanced version of Moonlight Android client, providing better streaming experience with additional features.
Based on Moonlight-Android project, enhanced by V+ team
Thank you for using Moonlight V+! If you like it, please give us a star on GitHub.
Check if there is a new version available
Gamepad type may be changed due to motion sensor emulation
Specify how to balance video latency and smoothness
Prefer smoothest video (may significantly increase latency)
Use an analog stick to scroll
Select an analog stick to scroll when in mouse emulation mode
Choose the position of the screen when using non-fullscreen resolution
Custom buttons and settings during streaming, saved to custom configurations for quick switching
Export custom button and streaming settings configuration file
Import custom button and streaming settings configuration file
Merge new configuration buttons into existing configuration
This is V+ X Royal Edition
Crown\'s Bilibili: XiguaHub, please follow them. GitHub: https://github.com/WACrown/moonlight-android
The crown function configuration has been exited
If an external display is connected, display the stream on the external display
Enter a custom background image API, or a single image URL. Leave empty to view random images
Please enter the complete image API
Swap width and height values for special display requirements
Help improve the app by sharing anonymous usage statistics
💡 Tip: Use the "Exit" button to quickly and completely exit the stream, restoring your screen to its pre-stream state~
💡 Tip: Long press the top blank area on the host list page to download the current wallpaper~
💡 Tip: Long press an app to choose virtual display streaming, super convenient!
💡 Tip: Using 5GHz WiFi provides a better experience, lightning fast speeds~
💡 Tip: The wallpaper API option can set the API for random wallpaper sources, or a single image address
💡 Tip: Using "Balanced" frame rate mode gives you the best balance of frame rate and latency, perfect!
💡 Tip: Enabling HDR provides better color and contrast performance. In Sunshine base version, binding the corresponding HDR profile can more precisely sync with the client screen, gorgeous colors~
💡 Tip: The 5 small sharks on the home page can quickly save and switch streaming configurations~
💡 Tip: Adjusting resolution can balance quality and performance, find the perfect settings~
💡 Tip: You can switch touch modes in the game menu. Enhanced multi-touch is suitable for mobile games, trackpad mode is great for office work. Find the operation method that suits you best~
💡 Tip: You can add custom key combinations, like Ctrl+Shift+Esc to quickly open Task Manager, making operations more convenient~
💡 Tip: The performance overlay can be dragged to any position, double-tap to switch between horizontal and vertical layouts, and click on various metrics to view detailed explanations~
💡 Tip: Enabling Dolby Atmos or DTS:X provides a more immersive audio experience, and you need to enable the system equalizer for the best effect~
💡 Tip: When connecting an external display, you can choose to display the stream on the external display in settings, making big screen gaming even more enjoyable~
💡 Tip: Virtual display function can create independent display spaces, especially suitable for multi-tasking scenarios, making streaming more flexible~
💡 Tip: When using HEVC or AV1 decoders, you can adjust the bitrate during streaming without exiting, finding the optimal bitrate for your network and device~
💡 Tip: You can edit the displayed function cards in the game menu. Unnecessary cards can be hidden~
Click on the keys to create a combination
Name and key code cannot be empty
Format error, key code must start with "0x"
Save failed, please check the format
There are no custom keys that can be deleted
The selected button has been deleted

To provide a complete PC gaming experience with your external keyboard, this service needs to capture all keyboard keys. 

 Once enabled, you will be able to use all system shortcuts like Win/Command keys, Alt+Tab, etc., just like on your computer. 

 Rest assured, this service is only used to send key operations directly to your computer, and we will not record or upload any of your input content.

Today's Moon Phase

%s %s
Moon Phase Cycle: %.1f%%
Cycle Day: Day %d
Date: %s

%s

The decoder is responsible for decoding video streams into displayable images.

Common Decoders:
• H.264 (AVC) - Best compatibility
• H.265 (HEVC) - Higher compression
• AV1 - Latest standard, most efficient

HDR Support:
• High Dynamic Range video
• Richer color representation
• Requires hardware support

Rx FPS: Received Frame Rate
• Number of video frames received from host
• Should be stable under ideal conditions

Rd FPS: Rendered Frame Rate
• Number of frames actually rendered to screen
• May be reduced due to device performance

Performance Indicators:
• Close values indicate good performance
• Low render FPS may affect smoothness

Packet loss represents the percentage of data packets lost during network transmission.

Normal Range:
• 0-0.5%: Excellent network quality
• 0.5-2%: Good network quality
• 2-5%: Fair network quality
• >5%: Poor network quality

Influencing Factors:
• Network stability
• Router performance
• Wireless signal strength

Network latency represents the round-trip time for data packets from host to device.

Latency Range:
• <20ms: Excellent
• 20-50ms: Good
• 50-100ms: Acceptable
• >100ms: Poor

Bandwidth:
• Represents network transmission speed
• Affects maximum video quality

± Value:
• Represents latency fluctuation range
• Smaller values indicate more stability

Decode latency represents the time required to decode video frames.

Latency Range:
• <5ms: Excellent decoder performance
• 5-10ms: Good decoder performance
• 10-20ms: Fair decoder performance
• >20ms: Poor decoder performance

Influencing Factors:
• Hardware decoder performance
• Video encoding complexity
• Device CPU/GPU load
• When decode latency is less than 10ms, it is recommended to pay attention to other performance of the device (e.g. frame rate, resolution, image quality, etc.)

Host latency represents the time for the game host to process frames.

Latency Range:
• <5ms: Strong host performance
• 5-10ms: Good host performance
• 10-20ms: Fair host performance
• >20ms: Weak host performance

Influencing Factors:
• Host hardware performance
• Game load
• Background program usage

Ver.V+:
• Indicates version information
• Displayed when no host latency data available
